publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1000# Cathie Craigie: National Lottery and Coalfield Regeneration—That the Parliament notes the publication by the Department of Culture, Media and Sport of research into the impact of the National Lottery on coalfield communities; acknowledges the contribution made by coal mining and coal miners to the economic, social and political development of Scotland, and urges the Scottish Executive to work with the National Lottery Charities Board’s Scotland committee to maximise access to Lottery funding for, and work towards the regeneration of, Scottish coalfield areas, including Kilsyth and its surrounding villages.
S1M-1000# National Lottery and Coalfield Regeneration (lodged on 12 June 2000) Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Cathy Jamieson*, Janis Hughes*
S1M-1000# National Lottery and Coalfield Regeneration (lodged on 12 June 2000) Margaret Jamieson*, Donald Gorrie*, Mike Watson*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-1000# National Lottery and Coalfield Regeneration (lodged on 12 June 2000) Mr John McAllion*

S1M-1000# Cathie Craigie: National Lottery and Coalfield Regeneration—That the Parliament notes the publication by the Department of Culture, Media and Sport of research into the impact of the National Lottery on coalfield communities; acknowledges the contribution made by coal mining and coal miners to the economic, social and political development of Scotland, and urges the Scottish Executive to work with the National Lottery Charities Board’s Scotland committee to maximise access to Lottery funding for, and work towards the regeneration of, Scottish coalfield areas, including Kilsyth and its surrounding villages. Supported by: Dr Sylvia Jackson, Cathy Jamieson, Janis Hughes, Margaret Jamieson, Donald Gorrie, Mike Watson, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr John McAllion
